title: Scaling Engineering with Codex and Claude Code Agentic Workflows
summary: This workflow demonstrates a hybrid approach to agentic coding, utilizing OpenAI's Codex for high-level, parallel background tasks (planning, bug fixing, testing) and Anthropic's Claude Code for granular, high-control terminal operations. The process emphasizes scaling compute by running multiple agentic loops simultaneously and managing the trade-off between control (terminal) and ease of use (web agents).

steps.action: Initialize parallel background tasks in Codex Web Interface
steps.reasoning: Leverages cloud compute to perform multiple distinct engineering tasks (explanation, bug fixing, planning) simultaneously without blocking the developer.

steps.action: Review agent-generated fix, create PR, and merge via GitHub
steps.reasoning: Validates the agent's work in the cloud environment before integrating it into the main branch.

steps.action: Sync changes locally to verify integration
steps.reasoning: Ensures the local development environment reflects the agentic changes merged remotely.

steps.action: Pivot strategy and launch new parallel planning/testing tasks
steps.reasoning: Demonstrates rapid prototyping by scrapping previous plans and using available compute to explore new architectural directions (YAML workflows) and testing strategies.

steps.action: Direct agent to implement specific validation tests based on approved design
steps.reasoning: Moves from high-level design to concrete implementation (pytest framework) using the agent's context of the codebase.

steps.action: Execute parallel file operations using terminal agent
steps.reasoning: Utilizes the 'parallel' keyword in the terminal to perform mass read/write operations across multiple files, demonstrating high-control granular editing.

key_takeaways: Scale success by scaling compute: Run multiple background tasks in parallel to maximize productivity.
The AI Coding Spectrum: Trade off Control (Terminal/Claude Code) for Ease of Use (Web/Codex) depending on the task.
Great planning is great prompting: Comprehensive specs lead to better agentic outputs.
Claude Code is a primitive: It offers raw, programmable access to the model for building custom workflows.
Compute Advantage Equation: Maximize compute scaling and autonomy while minimizing time and effort.
